subject: p16508811
History: History of renal transplant and chronic heart failure, fever, and cough.
Findings: As compared to the previous radiograph, the pre-existing opacity in the right lung apex has completely resolved. However, opacities at both lung bases are still present. The opacities appear less dense than on the previous image. Currently, no evidence of pulmonary edema is present. The size of the cardiac silhouette is at the upper range of normal. There is no evidence of pleural effusions on the frontal and lateral images.
